CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 31, 1959, page 6 reads: "Chipmunk Contest Winner - William (Bill) Toomey, left in left photo, receives a beautiful transistor radio from Radio Station WAMO's Bill Powell, popular disc jockey, after Toomey was announced as the first prize winner in station's "Alvin the Chipmunk" contest, last Friday. Toomey, of 4220 Lydia St., and a student at Connelly Vocational High School, sketched his idea of the off-key chipmunk (who can't carry a hot tune in a thermos jug) after hearing WAMO's contest rules. In the right photo, is Toomey's cool "Alvin," sartorially draped, in pegged slacks, argyle socks, pebble-grained ground grippers (shoes), Perry Como sweater, Ivy League tie and correct shirt and Tyrolean hat, on his way to join the other members of the quartet which had the hit was waffle of the recent Yuletide season - Photos by Harris and Drake."
TitMainTitle: William "Bill" Toomey holding radio, and radio broadcaster, Bill Powell holding WAMO microphone and "Alvin" chipmunk cartoon, standing in interior with light colored wall
